intro: Tynanthus croatianus, commonly known as the Croatian tynanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, and it often grows in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
